info.description: All requests to any Recruiterflow API must include the RF-Api-Key header. Unless otherwise specified, all data is in JSON. Domain for all API requests should be api.recruiterflow.com
info.title: Recruiterflow API Documentation

post.description:
**The below table describes the required input** |

Params

|

Data Type

|

Required

| | ------------------- | ------------------ | ----------------- | | associated_entities | object | True | | call_outcome_id | integer | True | | created_by | integer | True | | notes | object | optional | | title | string | optional | | start_time | date | True | | end_time | date | optional | | meeting_type_id | integer | optional | **Sample Payload** ``` { "associated_entities": { "candidates": [], "clients": [1] (Client Ids as Array of Integers), "contacts": [1, 2] (Contact Ids as Array of Integers), "deals": [1] (Job Ids as Array of Integer), "jobs": [] }, "call_outcome_id": 1 (Integer), "meeting_type_id": 1 (Integer), "created_by": 1 (Integer), "notes": { "value": "notes" (String), "mentions": [2] (User Ids as Array of Integers) }, "title": "Call Title" (String), "start_time": "2024-06-30T10:30:00+0000" (Date in ISO format), "end_time": "2024-06-30T10:30:00+0000" (Date in ISO format) } ```

associated_entities.description: The associated entities for the call.

candidates.description: The list of candidate ids associated with the call.

clients.description: The list of client ids associated with the call.

contacts.description: The list of contact ids associated with the call.

deals.description: The list of deal ids associated with the call.

jobs.description: The list of job ids associated with the call.

created_by.description: The user id who created the call.

end_time.description: The end time of the call in ISO format.

mentions.description: The list of user ids associated with the call.

start_time.description: The start time of the call in ISO format.

example.message: Please provide a valid call outcome id
The specified user is not present in your account

post.description:
Please find the format of custom field input below.
  • Single select:
    {
    "id": single_select_cf_id,
    "value": "string"
    }


  • Multi select :
    {
    "id": multi_select_cf_id,
    "value": ["string1", "string2"]
    }


  • Short/Long text:
    {
    "id": short_text_cf_id,
    "value": "text"
    }


  • Money:
    {
    "id": money custom field id,
    "value": {"number": Integer(The amount), "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Money Range:
    {
    "id": money reange custom field id,
    "value": {"number1": Integer(Starting Amount), "number2": "Ending Amount", "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Number/Date:
    {
    "id": cf_id,
    "value": number/date to store
    }


  • Yes No:
    {
    "id": yes_no_cf_id,
    "value": 0 for No and 1 for Yes
    }


  • Profile :
    {
    "id": profile_cf_id,
    "value": [{"id": profile_id, "type": entity_type(Candidate, Contact, Company)}]
    }


  • Parent-Child :
    {
    "id": parent-child-cf-id,
    "value": [{"name": "parent_name", "children": ["child1", "child2"]}]
    }


  • Users:
    {
    "id": users_cf_id,
    "value": [integer_user_id_1, integer_user_id_1]
    }
post.summary: Add a candidate record.

post.description:
Use the 'key' of the application form parts (from /api/external/job) as the form element names to pass values for each application form input.
Files can also be uploaded in the form using the appropriate 'key' from the application form detail.
post.summary: The add application form endpoint allows you to export application information about a job to Recruiterflow.

{
    "items_per_page": 20,
    "conjunction": "match-all",  
    "filters": [
                    {
                        "filter_type": "less-than", 
                        "is_relative": true, 
                        "key": "last_activity", 
                        "name": "Last activity", 
                        "rank": 1050,
                        "status": "COMPLETE",
                        "text": "less than 10 days ago",
                        "type": "date",
                        "days": 10
                    }
            ], 
    "current_page": 1,
    "include_count": true
}

Please find the format of custom field input below.
  • Single select:

    "id": single_select_cf_id,
    "value": "string"
    }


  • Multi select :
    {
    "id": multi_select_cf_id,
    "value": ["string1", "string2"]
    }


  • Short/Long text:
    {
    "id": short_text_cf_id,
    "value": "text"
    }


  • Money:
    {
    "id": money custom field id,
    "value": {"number": Integer(The amount), "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Money Range:
    {
    "id": money reange custom field id,
    "value": {"number1": Integer(Starting Amount), "number2": "Ending Amount", "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Number/Date:
    {
    "id": cf_id,
    "value": number/date to store
    }


  • Yes No:
    {
    "id": yes_no_cf_id,
    "value": 0 for No and 1 for Yes
    }


  • Profile:
    {
    "id": profile_cf_id,
    "value": [{"type": "candidate", "id": candidate_id}]
    }


  • Users:

activity_time.description: The time of the activity in ISO format.

activity_type_id.description: The id of the activity type.

activity_user_id.description: The id of the user who performed the activity.

associated_entities.description: The associated entities for the activity.

candidates.description: The list of candidate ids associated with the activity.

clients.description: The list of client ids associated with the activity.

contacts.description: The list of contact ids associated with the activity.

deals.description: The list of deal ids associated with the activity.

jobs.description: The list of job ids associated with the activity.

mentions.description: The list of mentions for the activity.

id.description: The id of the mentioned entity (user or team).

type.description: The type of mention (1 for user, 2 for team).

value.description: The name/value of the mentioned entity.

get.summary: Get all calls list for a deal

post.description:
Please find the format of custom field input below.
  • Single select:
    {
    "id": single_select_cf_id,
    "value": "string"
    }


  • Multi select :
    {
    "id": multi_select_cf_id,
    "value": ["string1", "string2"]
    }


  • Short/Long text:
    {
    "id": short_text_cf_id,
    "value": "text"
    }


  • Money:
    {
    "id": money custom field id,
    "value": {"number": Integer(The amount), "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Money Range:
    {
    "id": money reange custom field id,
    "value": {"number1": Integer(Starting Amount), "number2": "Ending Amount", "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Number/Date:
    {
    "id": cf_id,
    "value": number/date to store
    }


  • Yes No:
    {
    "id": yes_no_cf_id,
    "value": 0 for No and 1 for Yes
    }


  • Profile :
    {
    "id": profile_cf_id,
    "value": [{"id": profile_id, "type": entity_type(Candidate, Contact, Company)}]
    }


  • Parent-Child :
    {
    "id": parent-child-cf-id,
    "value": [{"name": "parent_name", "children": ["child1", "child2"]}]
    }


  • Users :
    {
    "id": users_cf_id,
    "value": [integer_user_id_1, integer_user_id_1]
    }

amount_currency.description: Currency of Amount.(Must be 3 letter iso codes. e.g "USD", "AUD")

client_company.description: Name of the Company associated with the Deal.

close_date.description: Deal close date in format YYYY-MM-DD. (Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST or CLOSED WON)

deal_owner_id.description: Owner ID associated with the Deal.

expected_close_date.description: Deal expected close date in format YYYY-MM-DD.

items.description: Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST.

stage_id.description: Stage ID associated with the Deal.

user_id.description: ID of a User moving the Stage.

items.description: Required only if moving to stage CLOSED WON.

post.summary: Create a New Deal.

get.summary: Lists all Deal custom fields available.

post.description: If file is being added by url, file_name is mandatory
post.summary: Please add ARGUMENTS (AS A FORM), the api is used to attach files to deals.

parameters.description: Deal id you want to fetch.
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Get details of a particular deal.
Get all stages for deal pipeline

close_date.description: Deal close date in format YYYY-MM-DD. (Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST or CLOSED WON)

expected_close_date.description: Deal expected close date in format YYYY-MM-DD.

items.type: string(Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST)

id.description: Stage ID of the destination stage.(You can send either Stage ID or Stage Name.)

name.description: Stage name of the destination stage.(You can send either Stage ID or Stage Name.)

user_id.description: ID of a User moving the Stage.

items.type: string(Required only if moving to stage CLOSED WON)

0.value:
{   
    "id": 1,
    "name"   : "Test Deal",
    "amount_currency": "USD",
    "amount": 1000,
    "stage_id": 7,
    "stage_name": "CLIENT PITCH"
    "user_id": 1,
    "close_date": "2023-01-01",
    "expected_close_date": "2023-01-01",
    "client_company": "X.Y.Z",
    "won_reason": null,
    "lost_reason": ["Candidate Rejected"],
    "deal_owner_id": 1,
    "entities":[
                    {
                        "id":26,
                        "name":"Test",
                        "type":2
                    }
                ],
    "custom_fields": [
                        {
                            "id":2,
                            "value":"This deal is a test."
                        }
                    ]
}

amount_currency.description: Currency of Amount.(Must be 3 letter iso codes. e.g "USD", "AUD")

client_company.description: Name of the Company associated with the Deal.

close_date.description: Deal close date in format YYYY-MM-DD. (Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST or CLOSED WON)

deal_owner_id.description: Owner ID associated with the Deal.

expected_close_date.description: Deal expected close date in format YYYY-MM-DD.

id.description: ID of a Deal to update.

items.type: string(Required only if moving to stage CLOSED LOST)

stage_id.description: Stage ID associated with the Deal(You can send either Stage ID or Stage Name.).

stage_name.description: Stage name of the Deal(You can send either Stage ID or Stage Name.).

user_id.description: ID of a User moving the Stage.

items.type: string(Required only if moving to stage CLOSED WON)

post.summary: Update the Deal.

post.summary: Get information about the external API.

get.description:
Please find the output format of different engagement types below.

Engagement Type : Contingent

Expected Salary


  • expected_salary: {
    currency: "USD",
    number: 700000
    }


    • Expected Fee


  • expected_fee : {
    currency: "USD",
    number: 35000
    }


    • Job Type


  • job_type : {
    id: 1,
    name: "Contingent"
    }


    • Commission Rate


  • commission_rate : 5


    • Engagement Type : Contract

    Job Type


  • job_type : {
    id: 3,
    name: "Contract"
    }


    • Contract Start Date


  • contract_start_date : "2022-08-29"


    • Contract End Date


  • contract_end_date : "2022-08-31"


    • Pay Rate


  • pay_rate : {
    currency: "USD",
    number: 5000,
    frequency: {
    display_name: "hr",
    id: 1,
    name: "hour"
    }
    }


    • Bill Rate


  • bill_rate : {
    currency: "INR",
    number: "5000",
    frequency: {
    display_name: "hr",
    id: 1,
    name: "hour"
    }
    }


    • Work Hours

get.summary: All filters available in the /api/external/job/list API except current_page, items_per_page

post.description:
Please find the input format details below.
  • about_position:
    Job Description


  • client_company_id:
    Please refer to the list of clients in client list api in the doc.


  • created_by:
    Id of the user creating the job.


  • department_id:
    Find the list of department ids in Other APIS.


  • employment_type_id:
    Find the list of employment type ids in Other APIS.


  • locations:
    Array of location ids, get the list of locations from /api/external/location/list API.


  • title:
    Job title.


    • Please find the format of custom field input below.
  • Single select:
    {
    "id": single_select_cf_id,
    "value": choice id (get the list from candidate/custom-field/list)
    }


  • Multi select :
    {
    "id": multi_select_cf_id,
    "value": [choice id1, choice id2] (get the list from candidate/custom-field/list)
    }


  • Short/Long text:
    {
    "id": short_text_cf_id,
    "value": "text"
    }


  • Money:
    {
    "id": money custom field id,
    "value": {"number": Integer(The amount), "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Money Range:
    {
    "id": money reange custom field id,
    "value": {"number1": Integer(Starting Amount), "number2": "Ending Amount", "currency": "string(Currency code eg. USD, GBP)"}
    }

  • Number/Date:
    {
    "id": cf_id,
    "value": number/date to store
    }


  • Yes No:
    {
    "id": yes_no_cf_id,
    "value": 0 for No and 1 for Yes
    }


  • Parent-Child :
    {
    "id": parent-child-cf-id,
    "value": [{"name": "parent_name", "children": ["child1", "child2"]}]
    }


  • Profile:
    {
    "id": profile_cf_id,
    "value": [{"type": "candidate", "id": candidate_id}]
    }


  • Users:
    {
    "id": users_cf_id,
    "value": [integer_user_id_1, integer_user_id_1]
    }

post.description:
Link

Note: Structure changes to {"data": [], "total_items": int} when include_count is enabled.


Please find the format of custom field input below.
{
"conjunction": "match-all",
"current_page": 1,
"filters": [
# Please add here from below list, according to your requirements!
],
"items_per_page": 100
}

  • Job company:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "job_client_company",
    "values": [4]
    }


  • Job Department:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "job_department",
    "values": [1]
    }


  • Job ID:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "job_id",
    "values": [1,2]
    }


  • Job Name:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "name",
    "values": ["Creator"]
    }


  • Job Custom field long and short text:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.5",
    "values": ["sample_long_text"]
    }


  • Job Custom field Multiselect/Single-select/Yes_No:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.6",
    "values": [4],
    }


  • Job Custom field Date:
    { "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.12",
    "date": "2021-10-04",
    "is_relative": false,
    "filter_type": "after"
    }


  • Job Custom field Number <"filter_type": "more-than/less-than/equal-to/between">:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.2",
    "filter_type": "more-than",
    "value": "10"
    }


  • Job Custom field Number <"filter_type": "between">:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.2",
    "filter_type": "between",
    "min_value": "22",
    "max_value": "33"
    }


  • Job Custom field Money <"filter_type": "more-than/less-than/equal-to/between">:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.11",
    "filter_type": "more-than",
    "value": {
    "currency": "INR",
    "number": "22"
    }
    }


  • Job Custom field Money <"filter_type": "between">:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "key": "custom_field.11",
    "filter_type": "between",
    "min_value": "22",
    "max_value": "33"
    }


  • Job Custom field Money range <"type": "range">:
    {
    "conjunction": "in",
    "input": "money",
    "key": "custom_field.11",
    "value": {
    "currency": "INR",
    "number": "22"
    }
    }
